alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 6:06AM MST until January 17 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST TUESDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 5500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 5500 feet near Alpine, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Grand Canyon, Heber-Overgaard, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Pine-Strawberry, Pinetop-Lakeside, Prescott, Show Low, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Additional snow forecast from 6 AM Today to 11 PM Tuesday: Alpine 4 to 8 inches Doney Park 4 to 6 inches Flagstaff 9 to 15 inches Forest Lakes 14 to 20 inches Grand Canyon 4 to 8 inches Heber-Overgaard 2 to 4 inches Jacob Lake 7 to 11 inches North Rim 11 to 17 inches Pine-Strawberry 3 to 5 inches Pinetop-Lkside 5 to 9 inches Prescott 1 to 2 inches Show Low 2 to 4 inches Valle 1 to 3 inches Williams 8 to 12 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
